name: Simple Bundt® Caramel Rolls
author: duboo
summary: Wonderful creamy and simple caramel rolls that everyone loves. Butter can be substituted for margarine.
ingredients: 3 (7.5 ounce) cans refrigerated biscuit dough (such as Pillsbury® Country Style)
½ teaspoon ground cinnamon, or to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Spray a fluted tube pan (such as Bundt®) with cooking spray
Melt margarine in a saucepan over medium-low heat
Stir cream and brown sugar into melted margarine until sugar dissolves, 2 to 3 minutes
Spread 1 can of biscuit dough into the bottom of the prepared tube pan; sprinkle with cinnamon
Layer 1 more can biscuit dough into the tube pan and sprinkle with cinnamon
Layer last can biscuit dough into tube pan
Pour margarine mixture over biscuit dough
Bake in the preheated oven until biscuits are slightly browned, about 20 minutes
Let biscuits cool 5 to 10 minutes in pan
Turn pan upside-down onto a serving plate and remove pan
